sentences.en: ...one of the most gifted players in the world.
sentences.cn: …世界上最有天赋的运动员之一。

sentences.en: As a surgeon, Philip was exceptionally gifted.
sentences.cn: 作为外科医生, 菲利普才华出众.

sentences.en: Even the most gifted can have confidence destroyed by the wrong instructor.
sentences.cn: 即使是最有天赋的人也可能会被错误的导师摧毁自信。

sentences.en: Great crises often call forth gifted leaders.
sentences.cn: 危急存亡之际常能产生天才的领袖.

sentences.en: He is gifted with rare eloquence.
sentences.cn: 他天生具有罕见的口才.

sentences.en: He was gifted, on occasion, with a gentle raillery, which almost always concealed a serious meaning.
sentences.cn: 他一有机会, 总爱说一些温和的讥诮言词, 但几乎每次都含着严正的意义.

sentences.en: He was witty, amusing and gifted with a sharp business brain.
sentences.cn: 他机智诙谐，具有敏锐的商业头脑。

sentences.en: Its descendants will reign over it forever, whether gifted or boobies.
sentences.cn: 它子子孙孙, 不论贤愚,都永远身居王位.

sentences.en: Michael may have been a dunce at mathematics, but he was gifted at languages.
sentences.cn: 迈克尔在数学上可能不太灵光，但在语言方面很有天赋。

sentences.en: Mr Sharp is a gifted lyricist who does something good in every song.
sentences.cn: 夏普先生是一位很有天赋的歌词作者，他在每首歌曲中都做出好成绩。

sentences.en: She counts among the most gifted of the current generation of composers.
sentences.cn: 她算是当代最有才华的一位作曲家.

sentences.en: She is as gifted as sedulous.
sentences.cn: 她不但有天赋，而且勤奋。

sentences.en: She was a distinguished oceanographer, and a gifted painter into the bargain.
sentences.cn: 她是一位杰出的海洋学家, 同时还是一位很有才华的画家.

sentences.en: She was a gifted teacher who never talked down to her students.
sentences.cn: 她天生就是当老师的料，从来不用居高临下的口气对学生说话。

sentences.en: The gifted author wrote one smash after another.
sentences.cn: 这个天才作家创作了一篇又一篇轰动一时的作品.

sentences.en: Third Fairy had been divinely gifted for a full thirty years.
sentences.cn: 三仙姑下神,足足有三十年了.

trans.tran_cn: 有天赋的，具有令人愉快的东西
trans.tran_en: having a natural ability to do one or more things extremely well
